alert.note: Alert for Allegany; Livingston; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 6:38AM EST until February 18 at 2:38PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... Genesee River At Portageville affecting Wyoming, Livingston and Allegany Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Genesee River At Wellsville affecting Wyoming, Livingston and Allegany Counties. .Heavy rain and snowmelt yesterday will continue to produce flooding today. For the Genesee River...including Wellsville, Portageville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Genesee River At Wellsville. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flood stage, banks overflow and begin to flood lowlying areas outside the levees in places such as Scio and Whitesville. Minor damages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:16 AM EST Friday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:16 AM EST Friday was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 5.6 feet early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.6 feet on 03/15/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 245 PM EST.
